when_to_use: Main body content across web pages
Descriptive text within components like cards, callouts, and banners
Explanatory information alongside forms and interactive elements
Terms and conditions, privacy policies, and other legal content
when_not_to_use: A heading would be more appropriate for section titles or page headings
A list (ordered or unordered) would better present information in a scannable format
Information can be better presented through tables, graphics, or other visual formats
Content requires special formatting such as code snippets or blockquotes
best_practices: Keep paragraphs concise—ideally 3-5 sentences—to improve readability and comprehension
Start with the most important information and use paragraphs to group related ideas together
Write in plain language, avoiding jargon and complex terminology where possible
Use the right size and weight variant for the context
Ensure paragraph text remains readable across all device sizes
Maintain adequate spacing between paragraphs to create visual separation
Maintain consistent styling of paragraphs throughout your site

features: Can be resized up to 200% without loss of content
Maintains readability when text spacing is adjusted
Uses Lexend font family for improved reading fluency

known_issues: Line height considerations in some contexts may need adjustment
Mobile text scaling on extremely small screens may need further size adjustments
Multilingual support may need additional considerations for different writing systems
variations: Size variants: Extra large, Large, Regular, Small
Margin variants: Default margin, No margin
Content variants: Plain text, HTML content

findings: Lexend font family research showing effectiveness for reading fluency
Reading patterns and optimal line length research supporting 12-15 words per line
Well-established typography and readability standards validation
